byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Stephen Farrell and Fares Akram from Gaza; Isabel Kershner from the Tel Nof air base and Mitzpe Hila, Israel; Heba Afify from Cairo; and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

abstract: Global hopes that Israel-Hamas prisoner exchange would improve chances for peacemaking and reconciliation are challenged when accusations of mistreatment from both sides make it immediately clear that exchange is also source of acrimony.
snippet: The prisoner exchange involving Sgt. First Class Gilad Shalit raised hopes of better relations, but it was also a source of acrimony.
lead_paragraph: The prisoner exchange involving Sgt. First Class Gilad Shalit raised hopes of better relations, but it was also a source of acrimony.

headline.main: Hard Feelings Test Hope in Israel-Hamas Deal
headline.print_headline: Hard Feelings Test Hope in Israel-Hamas Deal
headline.seo: Hard Feelings After Israel-Hamas Swap for Shalit
